title: Calories in 1 Cup Jasmine Rice
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 cup jasmine rice, including carbs, protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown per serving, and preparation tweaks for better health.
assumptions: Cooked jasmine rice (white), plain boiled or steamed, no added oil, salt, or seasonings; ~158 g per cup.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cooking method, water absorption, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of cooked jasmine rice provides ~205 kcal and 44 g of carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup cooked jasmine rice?
faqs.a: About 205 kcal for 1 cup of plain cooked jasmine rice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in 1 cup jasmine rice?
faqs.a: Approximately 44.5 g of carbohydrates, mostly starch.

faqs.q: Is jasmine rice high in protein?
faqs.a: No, just 4.3 g protein per cup; it's primarily a carb source.

faqs.q: Calories in uncooked vs cooked jasmine rice?
faqs.a: Uncooked is denser—1 cup dry (~185 g) has ~675 kcal, but expands when cooked.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in jasmine rice?
faqs.a: Boiled/steamed is lowest; frying or adding oil increases by 30–50 kcal per tsp.
